definitions.definition: used when referring to people, animals or things as the object of a verb or preposition, or after the verb be

examples.text: What are you doing with those matches? Give them to me.
Did you eat all of them?

definitions.definition: used instead of him or her to refer to a person whose sex is not mentioned or not known

examples.text: If anyone comes in before I get back, ask them to wait.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old Norse theim ‘to those, to them’, dative plural of sá; related to their and them.
